description.narrative: Project Development Objective is to demonstrate more effective watershed management through greater integration of programs related to rainfed agriculture, innovative and science based approaches, and strengthened institutions and capacities.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :PA Schedule, Section I, para 6 | Description :The Government of Karnataka shall, not later than three (3) monthsafter the Effective Date, issue a Government Order to grant WDD and DOH access to the proceeds of the Financing necessary toimplement the Project at the district level. | Due Date :23-Jul-2013

Finance Agreement :PA Schedule, Section I, para 7 | Description :The Government of Karnataka shall, not later than twelve (12)months after the Effective Date, appoint and thereafter retainthroughout Project implementation, internal auditors for the Projectoperating in accordance with terms of reference acceptable to the Association.vi | Due Date :23-Apr-2014

title.narrative: Pilot demonstration of crop production technologies
New hydrological monitoring equipment installed and functional
Digitized database library fully operational covering all project watersheds
Pilot demonstrations on watershed treatments saturation in selected micro-watersheds
Sub-watersheds in which soil and water conservation investments are made, based on Land Resource Inventory (LRI) recommendations
Sub-watershed management plans based on innovative science-based approaches and community consultation
Technical Staff trained on the use of LRI data for assisting farmers
Innovative and relevant science-based knowledge is used to develop Land Resource Inventories for micro-watersheds
Data from science-based approaches adopted by other departments/institutions in the state for planning
Farmers in each micro-watershed willing/intending to adopt at least two climate-adaptation and/or climate-mitigation practices recommended by LRI knowledge and sub-watershed management plans.
Farmers trained in each sub-watershed intending to adopt practices that are based on integrated land resource knowledge generated by the project
Farmers expressing satisfaction with the LRI-based assistance that Farmer Contact Centers provide.
Departments and institutions are provided access to information from the Digital Portal and Decision Support System.
M&E system established and operational in WDD
